name: Politechnika Łódzka (Lodz University of Technology)
goal:
Politechnika Lodzka (the Lodz University of Technology - TUL) is one of the biggest universities in the country (established in 1945). TUL is a research performing organizations active in the field of life sciences, being in the process of improving our Responsible Research and Innovation performance among other substantial institutional changes.
The University has 48 fields of study, 9 faculties, 3 colleges, International Faculty of Engineering (IFE), International Doctoral School (IDS), 669 PhD students. Total number of staff- 2705, number of academic staff – 1234, number of professors – 221. Number of students (first-cycle programmes, second-cycle programmes) - 16 726. Number of graduates in 2018 year - 3 518.
TUL carries out 211 projects (research, educational, social – national and international). It has 856 inventions and utility models filed in 2008-2018 and 532 patents granted. TUL ranks 3rd among Polish universities in the number of patent applications filed and granted. In 2016, the University was awarded, as the first technical university in Poland, the HR EXCELLENCE IN RESEARCH badge which certifies that the University follows the principles laid down in The European Charter for Researchers and The Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers. The benefit of this badge is improved recognisability and attractiveness of the University as a project partner in the European Research Area. The most important documents which regulate the operation and the organization of the University are (1) the Statute, (2) the Mission of the Lodz University of Technology - defines the main objectives of the development of the TUL with reference to: education of students; development of research and scientific staff; financial, international and educational policy, (3) the European Policy Statement which defines the foreign policy of the University with a special focus on the relations with European Partners in order to enhance the internationalization of education and research.
Politechnika Lodzka has established broad scientific cooperation with local and foreign universities and research units and takes an active part in research programmes. Lodz University of Technology cooperates with over 300 institutions in 40 countries. It provides several dozen of international research projects, and also takes active part in EU Framework Programs.
As one of the biggest universities in the country, TUL plays an important role in increasing the competitive edge of the regional as well as national and international economy. TUL's Technology Transfer Center provides support for effective cooperation of the academic community and business. This is an example of creative thinking and creative activity in research as well as in the transfer and commercialisation of advanced technologies and solutions.
According to the TUL Strategy for Development (Resolution № 4/2015 by 25.02.2015), TUL’s vision is that in 2020 it will be an Innovation Research University of technical profile with a strong international image and one of the best Universities in Poland. It will have a high intellectual potential and modern material bases for research activity on the highest world level which will impact to the development of science, economy and society.
